book.book_title: THE SECOND LETTER OF PAUL TO THE CORINTHIANS
book.title: Greeting
Thanksgiving for God's Compassion and Comfort
book.note: A reference to the Roman province of Asia (modern Asia Minor)
book.title: Paul's Clear Conscience
Paul Delays His Visit to Corinth
Forgive and Comfort the Offender
Triumphant Ministry in Christ
New Covenant Ministry
Proclaiming Jesus Christ as Lord
Treasure in Earthenware Jars
book.note: Some manuscripts have "in the face of Jesus Christ"
Lit. "according to an extraordinary degree to an extraordinary degree"
book.title: Absent from the Body and at Home with the Lord
book.note: A number of important early manuscripts read "have put it on" here
book.title: Controlled by the Love of Christ
Afflictions of God's Servants
book.note: Lit. "the mouth of us has opened"
book.title: Do Not Become Unevenly Yoked with Unbelievers
book.note: A quotation from Lev 26:12 (also similar to Jer 32:38, Ezek 37:27)
A paraphrased quotation from 2 Sam 7:14 and Isa 43:6
book.title: Paul's Joy at the Corinthians' Repentence
Generosity in Giving
Arrangements for Administering the Corinthians' Gift
book.note: Lit. "to the degree that if he might have"
Lit. "to the degree that he might not have"
book.title: God Loves a Cheerful Giver
book.note: Lit. "so that we do not speak about you"; some manuscripts have "so that I do not speak about you"
book.title: Paul's Ministry Defended
book.note: Lit. "for building up and not for tearing down of you"
book.title: Paul Defends His Apostleship
book.note: Some interpreters take this to refer to the original apostles in Jerusalem; others take Paul to be referring sarcastically to his opponents in Corinth.
book.title: Paul Boasts in His Sufferings
A Vision of Paradise
book.note: A majority of later manuscripts read "my"
book.title: Paul's Concern for the Christians at Corinth
book.note: Some interpreters take this to refer to the original apostles in Jerusalem; others take Paul to be referring sarcastically to his opponents in Corinth.
Lit. "for what is it with respect to which you are made worse off"
Lit. "anyone whom I sent to you, through him"
book.title: Final Warnings to the Church at Corinth
Final Greetings and Benediction
